content.description:
This one doesnt usually see much action, so if youre trying to find it by looking for previously chalked holds, it might be impossible to find. Make sure to bring a brush too, just incase there is some moss buildup.  

  SDS underneath the boulder on prominent crimps. Work your way out and up using compression and more crimps.
content.protection: 2 pads. The adjacent tree and block below the problem make it someone cumbersome to pad, but not too bad.
content.location: From The Watchtower boulder, head towards the largest and closest cluster of talus (dont head back towards Iron Lion).

content.description:
If lowball topouts is what youre searching for, then look no further. This odd shaped rock proves that even lowballs can be tricky. 

  SDS on jug on right side and work your way out!
content.location: From The Watchtower boulder, head into the small cluster of talus blocks that are west of you. You'll pass The Never Ending Biscuit and Lolos before reaching this little wonder.

content.description: From the main Top Rocks section, The Watchtower boulders make up a few scattered problems on rocks just to the north. The Watchtower is perhaps the most easily distinguishable cluster of boulders. Fitting to its name, it kind of looms off in the distance as a tower of concentrated blocks. From here, you can venture north west to find the few other lines in this area
